A B G I K M N P T

A

actionPerformed(ActionEvent) - Method in class GuiFrame.AnimationListener
the actionPerformed method is called every time the timer runs out

B

Ball - Class in <Unnamed>
The ball class allows you to create ball objects for the game brickbreaker
Ball(int, int, int) - Constructor for class Ball
this is the main constructor for the ball class
Brick - Class in <Unnamed>
the brick class allows you to create individual brick objects for brickbreaker
Brick(int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class Brick
this is the main constructor for the brick class and creates a new and alive brick given an x and a y coordinate

G

Game - Class in <Unnamed>
the game class extends JComponent and allows you to create a game object that will run gameplay for brickbreaker the game will continue to run until it has been closed, you will start with 4 (0,1,2,3) lives and if the lives go below 0 the game will reset itself and run again if you clear all of the bricks you will recieve one more life and a new board will be drawn, your score will keep being counted as long as you dont lose all your lives 1 round = 3200 points or one clear of the entire board in order to control the paddle you use the mouse, if the paddle does not appear to be centered with the x coordinate of the mouse pointer then restart the game and make sure your mouse is over the game window while it begins
Game() - Constructor for class Game
this is the main constructor for the game class which takes no arguments and initializes the paddle and ball and starts a new game automatically
GameViewer - Class in <Unnamed>
The GameViewer class allows you to start playing the brickbreaker game
GameViewer() - Constructor for class GameViewer
 
get_X_Coordinate() - Method in class Ball
the get_X_Coordinate() method allows you to access the x coordinate of the balls upper left corner
get_X_Coordinate() - Method in class Paddle
 
get_Y_Coordinate() - Method in class Ball
the get_Y_Coordinate() method allows you to access the y coordinate of the balls upper left corner
getHeight() - Method in class Brick
the getHeight method allows you to get the bricks height
getWidth() - Method in class Brick
the getWidth method allows you to get the bricks width
getX() - Method in class Brick
the getX method allows you to get the x coordinate of the bricks upper left corner
getY() - Method in class Brick
the getY method allows you to get the y coordinate of the bricks upper left corner
GuiFrame - Class in <Unnamed>
The GuiFrame class extends the jframe class, it initializes a game object to start the game as well and also contains the action listener class for animating the ball
GuiFrame() - Constructor for class GuiFrame
this is the main constructor for the GuiFrame class, it adds the game to frame as well as initializing the action listener and adding it to the game
GuiFrame.AnimationListener - Class in <Unnamed>
The animationlistener class is used to run a timer to run the ball animation and paddle animation AnimationListener implements ActionListener
GuiFrame.AnimationListener() - Constructor for class GuiFrame.AnimationListener
this is the main constructor for the AnimationListener class

I

isAlive() - Method in class Brick
 
isInside(int, int) - Method in class Brick
the isInside method allows you to check to see if a certain (x,y) point is inside the bricks bounds the method returns a boolean true if the coordinates are inside the brick
isInside(int, int) - Method in class Paddle
 

K

kill() - Method in class Brick
the kill method allows you to destroy the brick, it sets the isAlive boolean to false

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class GameViewer
this initializes the GuiFrame and starts the game
moveBallBy(int, int) - Method in class Ball
the moveBallBy method allows you to move the ball by a specified amount in the x and y directions
moveBallTo(int, int) - Method in class Ball
the moveBallTo method allows you to transport the ball to a certain x,y coordinate
movePaddleTo(int, int) - Method in class Paddle
 

N

newBoard() - Method in class Game
the newBoard method redraws the board it will also increment the round number and lives by 1
newGame() - Method in class Game
the newGame method allows you to create a new game with score=0 and lives=3, it will also reset the board and round number

P

Paddle - Class in <Unnamed>
Write a description of class Paddle here.
Paddle() - Constructor for class Paddle
 
paddleMovement() - Method in class Game
the paddleMovement method moves the paddle in line with the mouse so that the center of the paddle is in line with the mouses x coordinate
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Ball
the paintComponent method draws the ball object
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Brick
the paintComponent method draws the brick
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Game
the paintComponent method draws all of the graphics for the game including the board, score, and calls the draw methods for the bricks, ball, and paddle
paintComponent(Graphics) - Method in class Paddle
 
playGame() - Method in class Game
the playGame method runs the main gameplay, it controls the balls movement and all collisions with a brick, the walls or the paddle it also calls the balls move method and checks to see of the players lives have run out yet or if the board has been cleared, if the board has been cleared it will call newBoard()

T

timer - Variable in class GuiFrame.AnimationListener
